sections.title: Breaking Changes
lines: This is the final large update before the public launch of FADE.
Some settings may need to be re-configured after updating.
Please carefully take note of the following required actions to take before updating:

sections.title: App Permissions
lines: MacOS will ask again for Accessibility and Input Monitoring Permissions. You will need to re-grant both permissions and then restart the app.
The app's identifier changed to reflect the new company name FADE Audio, and macOS will see the app as new.
For the simplest transition, do this before updating: go to System Settings -> Privacy and Security. Remove (not disable) FadeControl from both the Accessibility and Input Monitoring section lists.
This will prevent a duplicate FadeControl item from appearing after updating.

sections.title: Firmware Upgrade
lines: A firmware upgrade may be required for your device. When the updated app opens, a firmware upgrade window should appear and walk you through the process. This will be required in order to continue using FADE.

sections.title: MIDI Ports
lines: MIDI Ports have been renamed for consistency. Please update your DAW to connect to the correct ports:
Logic: FADE Logic MCU
Pro Tools: FADE HUI BANK (1...4)
Ableton: FADE Ableton MCU
Cubase/Nuendo: FADE Steinberg Remote (You only need to install the new script, see below)
MIDI (CC): FADE MIDI

sections.title: Cubase/Nuendo MIDI remote script
lines: A new script is available. Please install by opening the DAW Setup window and selecting your DAW.

sections.title: Ableton Live Mappings
lines: Ableton Live now has its own dedicated DAW category for preset mappings. It is no longer using MCU Generic mappings.

sections.title: Features
lines: Modifier Mappings: Now, a single preset can contain a huge set of mappings, switchable using the modifier keys on your keyboard.
Brand new UI in support of the new preset structure. Preset editor now shows FADE connection status.
New DAW Setup window: Assists in configuring FADE with your DAW of choice. Handles script installation when necessary.

App update feature: Now, you can see when new versions of FadeControl are available within the preset editor. Updating is as easy as a single click. The app will be downloaded, installed, and relaunched automatically.
Improved menu bar appearance: Icon is now a single fader instead of three. Icon and preset abbreviation menu bar appearance are more customizable in Global Settings.
Preset switch popup UI: Now, when you use the LED button press + Knob touch/spin combo to hot-swap the presets, you can see a full list of presets and even open the preset editor.

Improved HUI autobank. It is now faster at detecting when a bank change has completed, reducing the overall time considerably in large projects. Using 4 banks is still recommended for projects with over 150 tracks.
Idle LED Mode: You can now configure how the LED shines when powered on but idle (for those who prefer a more subdued effect)

sections.title: Fixes
lines: Pointer drag now works system-wide on all controls, in particular several Reaper and Ableton controls. FADE now sends mouse events directly as a HID class-compliant device.

Pro Tools Automation Mode Toggle Action: Fixes an issue causing automation modes to be changed unexpectedly, especially when changing tracks. Previously, FADE was attempting to poll the automation mode to keep the LED up-to-date. Unfortunately, this doesn't seem to be feasible with HUI. Now, the LED will only show the automation state after the user toggles the state via FADE.

sections.title: Cubase/Nuendo MIDI remote script
lines: A new script is available. Please install by opening the DAW Setup window and selecting your DAW.

sections.title: Presets
lines: There have been significant changes in how presets are set up given the new modifier mappings. Your presets will not migrate to the new version.
Please take note of your current presets before upgrading.
Apologies - this is a one-time event as we transition from beta to public release.

sections.title: Ableton Live Mappings
lines: Ableton Live now has its own dedicated DAW category for preset mappings. It is no longer using MCU Generic mappings.
